bill_title: require lighted front and rear lamps on motor vehicles when the windshield wipers are in use.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require lighted front and rear lamps on motor vehicles when the windshield wipers are in use. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 32-17-4 be amended to read as follows: 32-17-4. Every Each vehicle upon a highway within this state during the period from a half hour after sunset to a half hour before sunrise and at any other time when there is not sufficient light to render clearly discernible any person on the highway at a distance of two hundred feet ahead, shall be equipped with lighted front and rear lamps as respectively required . If it is raining and the windshield wipers are in use, the vehicle shall be equipped with lighted front and rear lamps. The requirements for front and rear lamps are specified in §§ 32-17-1 to 32-17-26, inclusive, for different classes of vehicles and subject to exemption with reference to lights on parked vehicles as declared in . If the vehicle is parked or stopped on a highway, the vehicle shall comply with § 32-17-27. A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
